p:
Pastorczyk, M. et al.
15 reported that (1) the expression of CYP71A12 and PAD3 is strongly induced in the pen2 mutant defective in preinvasive resistance, but not in WT, upon the inoculation of the non-adapted pathogen Ctro and (2) CYP71A12 and PAD3 are involved in postinvasive resistance against Ctro. To assess whether CYP71A12 and PAD3 are expressed during postinvasive resistance against Ab, we investigated the expression pattern of these genes at several time points after Ab inoculation (at 4, 12, 24, and 48 h postinoculation, hpi). Although lesion development by Ab in pen2 was comparable to that in WT (Fig. 1), we used the pen2 mutant for the analysis to exclude a potential contribution of PEN2 to preinvasive resistance to Ab.
